page.title: 05Callow Wood-Lydden
page.content: The trees in Callow Wood were predominantly hazels,mixed with ash,elder and some oaks.The floor of the wood was carpeted with dog's mercury and beneath this layer primroses and bluebells could be seen. These were beginning to die back.The wooded track suddenly opened out onto a cleared area covered in chalk rubble containing a derelict car.Very few plants grew on the chalk but there were many growing around the edges of the clearing.These included buttercups,speedwells,forget-me-nots, scarlet pimpernels,agrimony,willow herb,woody nightshade and hemlock,all in flower.Other plants included creeping cinquefoil,which was beginning to colonise the chalky area,thistles, burdock and stinging nettles. Among the chalk boulders we found ants, centipedes,woodlice,snails and slugs.
